location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Letter No 11 of 1822 from William Bruce, Resident at Bushire to Francis Warden, Chief Secretary to the Government, Political Department, Bombay

mods.abstract: The letter is informing the Bombay Government of news relayed to the Resident by Shaikh Nabib bin Abdella and Shaikh Abdella bin Ibrahim [Shaikh ‘Abdullāh bin Ibrāhīm], son of Ibrahim bin Gannem [Ibrāhīm bin Ghānim], Governor of Katife [Al-Qaṭīf]. The letter outlines Turkish efforts to garrison and control parts of the Arabian side of the Persian Gulf. It also notes the capture of Shaikh Taskee, a relation of the late Wahabee [Wahhabi] Chief Abdella bin Savod [‘Abdullāh bin Sa‘ūd], by Turkish forces the previous year.Included with the letter is a list of gifts presented by the Resident to the news bearers.
